topic.title: is there a way to block channels on ifs ?
A guide to run ZeroNet with tor on linux
topic.body:
1-download zeronet bundle from https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet-linux/archive/dist-linux64/ZeroNet-py3-linux64.tar.gz
2-install tor (apt-get install tor)"debian" or (pacman -S tor)"arch" make sure it's the latest version
3-run the following command "sudo usermod -a -G tor [yourlinuxuser]" (arch) or "sudo usermod -a -G debian-tor [yourlinuxuser]" (debian) then logout and login
4-add the following options in /etc/tor/torrc: (in the end of file)
ControlPort 9051
DataDirectoryGroupReadable 1
CacheDirectoryGroupReadable 1
CookieAuthentication 1
CookieAuthFileGroupReadable 1
CookieAuthFile /var/lib/tor/control_auth_cookie
restart tor service "systemctl restart tor.service"
5-VERY IMPORTANT , make sure to change permissions "sudo chmod 0750 /var/lib/tor"
you can check for permission "stat -c%a /var/lib/tor" if it prints 750 then you are good
6-start zeronet via ./ZeroNet.sh
